website_summaries.verdict: Extra large waffles with deep pockets for texture at a great price.
pros: Easy to clean stainless steel exterior makes it quick to clean up after breakfast
Handle stays cool while cooking for safety and comfort
Adjustable temperature controls are a stand-out feature at such a low price
cons: Some users tell us they can tell it is a budget waffle maker by its construction

customer_reviews.title: Got this waffle iron in July of 2017 and when ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this waffle iron in July of 2017 and when fixing breakfast for family the day after christmas it blew up. When opening the lid the wires touched because of a design flaw and blew flames out the back! Do not buy. When sent email to Oster gave us a standard reply that they had too much volume to contact us. We then called the 800 number and were told to much volume and please call back. This item was not used that much to blow out flames causing a fire hazard. Would have gave zero stars but that's not allowed!
customer_reviews.author: SLB

customer_reviews.title: Solid value
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant on buying this just because it was the cheapest, but I've been really happy with it. There are no real fancy features and it doesn't tell you when the waffle is done, but it doesn't really need to. If you just like waffles sometimes and have a general idea of how long they take to cook, this will be great for you!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Lousy product, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Uneven heating and browning. The bottom plate turns the waffle completely brown, while the top plate doesnt generate as much heat. The top plate does not come in complete contact with the batter. If you try to fill more, it spills out. Unable to return due to a technical issue with the amazon website.
customer_reviews.author: Suitmonkey

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money. Defective poor quality and only partial refund available when returned.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and used Oster products for decades and loved them all excellent quality and performance. This waffle maker is the exception. It is very poorly made and the waffles it makes are not fully cooked when it says they are done. To make matters worse Amazon will not give you full credit when you return this pile of junk for being defective.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Can’t seem to make a perfect waffle with these.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t seem to make a perfect waffle with these. I attached pictures showing how the manufacturer suggested way to distribute batter. No matter what I do the waffles come out with holes. Not the best waffle maker I have had. But I’m going to work with it for at least 2 years before considering purchasing a better one. I do like the indicator light that lets me know the iron is ready for use.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Surprised That It's an Amazon Best Seller - I Trusted the Reviews :-(
customer_reviews.text: Questioning the quality, as it sounds like there are broken bits of plastic beneath the plates. Not the best design, with screw wells near the hinge that fill with waffle batter and make for a crumby clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted for 14 months
customer_reviews.text: Our previous waffle iron lasted for over 10 years. This one lasted just over a year, with about once a month usage. It is such a simple design, it should have lasted much longer. Our failure mode was that the bottom side stopped heating, so only the top was cooked and the bottom was still uncooked. It failed in the middle of a batch of waffles. The first waffles cooked normally and then it just stopped working in the middle of the batch.
customer_reviews.author: HappiDad

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two both defective
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as used on amazon and it didn't heat up when received. I am retiring it but leaving the review for others help. The second one i ordered the handle was disconnected and would not screw in. I have received the second messed up one and am still awaiting the refund for the first broken one.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Woolman

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate product.
customer_reviews.text: I will spend money on a better iron next time. This one just doesn’t work well. We have tried several different recipes. One half of the iron doesn’t cook the waffle enough and the other half gets it too dark. I have spent several hours using this and it’s been a frustrating waste of good ingredients and time, with hungry and disappointed kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S

customer_reviews.title: Not at described
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this product. It describes deep pockets for a belgian waffle. the pockets are very shallow. it created a thin waffle with burned centers. i burned myself twice as there is almost nowhere but a small plastic tab in the front to touch that is cool. this is a dangerous appliance to have. i do not like it as much as the ambiano product i was trying to replace but cannot find. i do not recommend this product and it's a shame because usually oster is a pretty good brand.
customer_reviews.author: Paula B.

customer_reviews.title: Makes great waffles.
customer_reviews.text: This product works just as advertized. It makes great waffles. They don't stick in the iron (of course I spray PAM on the surfaces before pouring the batter) as they did in my previous iron. I let them cook until the steam is gone and a little beyond, as I prefer them brown and crispy. If you take them out right when the light comes on, they aren't quite done enough for me. The shipping was fast and the product well packaged. And the price was great. Clearly an excellent buy, as long as cooking one waffle at a time is okay.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth W.

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker is so easy to use and clean. You can make the waffles as soft or as hard as you like depending on how long you let the waffles cook. The cook time will also determine the color (tan, golden, or brown) of the waffle. Great product to have!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B

customer_reviews.title: Good waffle maker for the occasional user
customer_reviews.text: I don't make waffles very often, so I have not used this very much, however when I have used it I find that it works very well, the instructions are easy to follow, and the adjustments are easy to do in order to get that perfect golden brown waffle.
customer_reviews.author: George K.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Does not make crisp waffles no matter which setting or recipe we tried. Flabby waffles are yucky. The top feels flimsy/rickety on the hinge. The one that was sent to us was missing some of the nonstick coating on the edge. Even at the lightning deal price it was more than our old $10 Black and Decker that we were trying to replace (a similar design, so we know how the waffles *should* have turned out!)
customer_reviews.author: Harvest

customer_reviews.title: waffle maker is not working
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a heavy user. but the waffle maker was out of order while making a waffle for breakfast this morning. this maker is in the warranty. can I get it to a new?
customer_reviews.author: KiYoung Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: For me I have had no problems with the waffle maker. I wanted a simple, easy to use non stick but not Teflon, or other harmful chemical substances. This does the trick for me! I make waffles at least twice a week. No mess no horrible offensive smell either. There is a slight scent from the platew the first time you hear it up, but that happens with basically every maker as the pan isn't seasoned yet. It dissipates quickly, the waffle tastes normal, and haven't had a problem at all. Easy to use and absolutely nothing has stuck! I don't use any oil or butter on the plates either.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Great Waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this awhile ago and have been making breakfasts and desserts ever since. Love it! Super easy to use and clean. Makes waffles very fast, I've never had one stick yet. (I use the butter spray). At first it looked very small, but the waffles are just the right size. I highly recommend getting this Oster Waffle Maker.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Gesell

customer_reviews.title: Heavenly Waffle Maker BUT Bad shipping
customer_reviews.text: Pors I LOVE this waffle maker! I have had three in my life, and because of moving etc I lost the first two. I replaced this waffle maker to make Keto Chaffle and Keto protein waffles on my diet and I LOVE it more then the Dash Mini waffle maker I have. Love the metal case. Cons Don’t like that it was made in China BIG CON Why is it shipped in the self box where you can tell what’s inside? It needs some kind of other box. Anyone could tell what it is and take it. Also I was lucky I was at home waiting and it did not get damaged from the heavy rain today.
customer_reviews.author: Rickie Hammond

customer_reviews.title: It worked really well, until it didn't...
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the hang of the temperature setting and the duration, which is all just trial and error with this unit, it worked quite nicely. We had a month of good reliable waffling. We were happy. Then the internal thermostat decided that it didn't want to cooperate any longer. Sometimes a given temperature setting and time would result in almost burnt waffles, sometimes they'd be woefully under done. Only the waffle maker itself knew in advance what our breakfast was going to look like. Granted, this is an inexpensive waffle maker, but I wasn't expecting it to be quite so disposable.
customer_reviews.author: Leicanthrope

customer_reviews.title: If you want to babysit your waffle maker this is the ONE.
customer_reviews.text: I hated that as soon as the green light went off SO DID THE WAFFLE MAKER. I kept having to crank it up and babysit this item. Just to get one serving. And it doesn't matter how high you crank it, once it's green it has to cool down to restart. UGH. Don't like it and want to return asap.
customer_reviews.author: LorFalcon

customer_reviews.title: Follow the Directions
customer_reviews.text: Take the time to read the preheat are care before your first waffle batch. This is a great little waffle maker. It heats up quickly and is easy to clean. I like to make batter and have it in the refrigerator so it's easy to make fresh in the morning. Flowing the directions it is easy to lift out the waffle with a firm tug. I use these little waffle maker a lot, just this morning again as a matter of fact. I couldn't be happier. Healthy breakfasts are my priority. Of course I have my own oat grain recipe with is an awesome team with this waffle maker. I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Bishmaya

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a waffle maker... so keep that in mind. My first impression is that it works great. I read all the instructions and seasoned it like it says. No stickiness, no negatives. Yummy and easy waffles. I would recommend this to anyone who just wants a decent, well working, functional waffle maker. I’m glad I didn’t spend loads more on a “specialty” one. I haven’t tried any yet, but I thought it was super nice and thoughtful that the brand also gives you SEVERAL recipes to try with it! I plan on trying them !
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Not even worthy of selling at a garage sale for $1.
customer_reviews.text: This product only cooks one half a waffle. The other side comes out un done. I never have experienced this defect in any waffle maker before. Made a beautiful buttermilk waffle mix and this crappy machine led to a waste of a morning with half finished waffles. I can’t even return it because I am not willing to go stand in line at the post office with this COVID 19 outbreak and get infected. Won’t be ordering from this company and making sure to double check negative reviews. This waffle iron would not even be worth a dollar at a garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Just get detachable plates. Much easier to clean
customer_reviews.text: Dont make the same mistake as me. Dont buy a waffle maker that doesn't have detachable pieces. It makes it very difficult to clean...especially if you make leige waffles with pearl sugar like I did. I suppose if you are making basic non sugary waffles it wouldn't be too difficult to just wipe down and everything else about it is fine but honestly...detachable all the way
customer_reviews.author: Hbugg96

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre Waffler Maker, But Decent For The Price
customer_reviews.text: Paid almost nothing for this thing, and it makes waffles, so I'm still giving it 3 stars, but my recommendation would be to spend $20 and get a more robust model. It gets way hot, has lots of nooks that get batter and butter in them, and temp control is inconsistent. But if you only make waffles once a month, this will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: dub

customer_reviews.title: A great little Waffle Maker for a small counter space
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little waffle maker for the price. The ready light only means the plates are hot and ready to pour your batter on and close it. This is not the Waffle Maker for you if you want or need it to let you know your waffle is ready. Also, this Waffle Maker does not make crispy waffles. After you take your waffle off the waffle plate, put it in your oven toaster to get it crispy.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Hey, we ate all the waffles
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a solid waffle maker. I gave it 4 stars because my waffles are not coming out crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside - but they are very tasty. I've used waffle makers before so I don't think this can be 100% user error. At any rate it is not super easy to achieve a perfect waffle, but certainly it's satisfactory for a $17 waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: crissibeth17Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It makes great waffles which don't stick to the iron
customer_reviews.text: It makes great waffles which don't stick to the iron. It heats up very quickly, and overall performs the functions you'd expect of a waffle maker. I will say that I've been trying to teach it to be self aware, and that hasn't worked.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Dan

customer_reviews.title: Oster "Belgian" waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a waffle maker by Oster. That is true. It is definitely NOT a maker of BELGIAN waffles, which typically have considerably deeper pockets. I do like that they make round waffles, which means no dry corners (thanks Alton Brown). and the temperature control is nice, but I didn't see much difference between low & high -- more like low and lower. I typically like Oster products, in fact, I bought their bread maker at the same time I liked. This waffle maker is going for charity, and I'll keep looking for a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Yellow Pencil

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. No bells and whistles, just a plain waffle maker that does the job. Because of the other reviews, I really don’t pay attention to the green light (other than when it tells me it’s ready to use), so I’m not sure if it’s reliability. I simply keep an eye on it and get a feel by lifting and checking if waffle is done. If you want to walk away and hear bells when your waffle is done, then this is not for you, but if you want a simple machine that does the job, it’s definitely worth the $13.
customer_reviews.author: HortGuy

customer_reviews.title: Probably better to get a slightly pricier one than this model that will last longer
customer_reviews.text: Made some of the best waffles I’ve had in ages the first few times I used it. However it seems I got what I paid for in price as it now flickers on and off during cooking and at times the lights don’t even work anymore and the temperature gauge seems to be off (what used to give golden brown no longer gives the same heat, so had to keep increasing the mob to get same results as before). Also, I recommend notching your favorite temp spot with a marker. For $25 bucks I got a couple weeks of delicious waffles, but was really hoping it would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Davis

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing because my son is absolutely obsessed with waffles so I figured this might be more economical brooch to fulfilling his needs. Turns out he doesn't really like my homemade Belgian waffles a whole lot but me and the rest of my family love them so we're making all kinds of crazy waffles now and we love it. Hopefully my son will come around one day.
customer_reviews.author: Max DR

customer_reviews.title: Basic and works well, very much a pain in the butt to clean
customer_reviews.text: This device can make fine waffles and is easy to use. However, to clean it you would need to unscrew the plates from the device. The device cannot be placed in a sink full of water. You can clean it poorly by wiping it over and over again with . cloth or paper towel, but it is difficult to get it clean. I don't eat waffles that often, but when I do, I want a clean waffle iron and to not have 2 week old crunchy bits in my fresh hot waffle. This is why I gave it 2 starts overall. If I could slide the waffle plates out and wash in the sink.
customer_reviews.author: PrairiePrankster

customer_reviews.title: Failed waffle maker. Not working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Received this waffle maker in Feb 2020 and worked great until now May 2020, 3 months. All of a sudden waffles are sticking and not fully cooking. Our research I dictates sticking waffles occur due to waffle.maker not being hot enough. We can only conclude that temperature thermostat is not working. Unfortunately our return window has closed. So will try to address directly with manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: JLMDG

customer_reviews.title: Dependable waffle maker for a low price
customer_reviews.text: Cheap waffle maker that works well enough for me! I hosted a brunch and just needed a small waffle maker to churn out a bunch of waffles. This maker worked perfectly and is easy to use. The first waffle I made was a primer to remove that new waffle maker smell, but after that I had no problem serving the rest. It also is small enough that I can use it on my counter with other things happening and easily store it in my small apartment kitchen. It's not the fanciest but it gets the job done for those of us that just dabble in waffle making.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Boyer

customer_reviews.title: An okay waffle iron for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's just okay. Makes waffles, not very fast though. The indicator light means nothing other than the thermostat is turning the heating element on and off at the setting you choose. You have to watch for the steam to slow down to know your waffle is done. Don't use their waffle recipe! It uses too much butter and it doesn't make it taste better or have the right texture. Better recipes are found in Southern Living and Good Housekeeping cookbooks.
customer_reviews.author: JuneTex

customer_reviews.title: Don't judge us for our waffle consumption
customer_reviews.text: We eat waffles like some people sleep, or how others brush their teeth -- daily. Momma don't eat 'um, even though she makes 'um. She has an aversion to carbohydrates. Me and the kids, we like 'um. There are five of us waffle eaters. One waffle iron wasn't enough. We needed two. Truth be told, I think we need five. Then everyone can start at once. Waiting on a hot, crsip waffle is torture. This is a good, cheap waffle iron.
customer_reviews.author: seanstermonster

customer_reviews.title: Oster is a solid brand
customer_reviews.text: Great little waffle maker. I've started to like Oster products lately and this one didn't disappoint. Makes great waffles. It is easy to use and clean. Power cord wraps up behind for compact storage. The only little complain is that yes it stands upright to store away in small kitchen areas but it doesn't lock together. When it's standing, it has a gap between the two halves and it feels as if it could open up while standing. It would surely take an intentional knock for it to fall open but I'm just saying. It's not enough to take off a star. I'm still happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: For the price is really good! But about those red/green lights...
customer_reviews.text: I got it today and it's pretty good for the price. The only thing it bothers me is the Red light and Green light. I waited a lot for the green light to turn on. It never did. Still I made the waffles using a timer. It did a decent waffle. My kids loved it so that matters to me :)
customer_reviews.author: LiaRios

customer_reviews.title: Worst product I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I am frankly shocked at the great reviews this product received. The waffle maker is true garbage. It heats up so high that it's impossible to touch without oven mitts, so forget about letting kids help make waffles. In almost every single instance, the batter stuck to the top and bottom and instead of having delicious waffles to enjoy, I was scraping it off the waffle maker. This is true even with oiling and spraying it. On the few occasions we did manage to have a decent waffle made, it was flat and unenjoyable. Save yourself the aggravation and do not buy this item. While inexpensive, it is nevertheless not worth the money. Truly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great little waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: great little waffle maker with several heat settings and SO easy to clean. perfect for out small storage and for cooking a few waffles. glad i got it!
customer_reviews.author: Shae Regan

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, but no timer or sensor.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and truly non-stick. However, it lacks a timer or done sensor, which is at least a one star ding. You will need to keep an eye on the time and self-select a temperature setting that works for you. The first waffle came out great, so it passed that test!
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good if you don't like your waffles crispy
customer_reviews.text: My waffles are squishy and not crunchy. I've tried using different recipes, adding cornstarch, adding corn meal, cooking longer, cooking hotter...nothing works. The waffles taste fine, but they're like pancakes with convenient syrup holes, not crispy fluffy waffles. I'm giving it two stars because it does work to make waffles, I just don't like them. I'll be getting a different one for our grilled bread product needs.
customer_reviews.author: EO in KC

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Being lazy, I use a complete pancake mix for my waffles, and they turn out fluffy and good. New favorite recipe: a shake of cinnamon and top with sugar-free apple pie filling. With a spritz of whipped cream, I could serve that as dessert and impress! It took me about seven waffles to understand where to set the dial for my altitude, that the batter should be on the thick side, and when to close the lid (give it four or five seconds), but now every one is perfect and I never spill over. Next shopping cart item will have to be exercise equipment, because it's awfully attractive to make one before bed, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: As good or better than any I’ve used; cute, compact
customer_reviews.text: I’m satisfied. It makes crispy waffles but I’ve only used it twice. No waffle maker is easy to clean, and this model is no exception. I brush oil on the grates with every waffle—because I don’t care what any waffle maker claims, one initial coat won’t prevent sticking on an ongoing basis. This one is more compact and more aesthetically pleasing than my last one—two points in its favor
customer_reviews.author: errborn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I had been waiting forever to buy my own Waffle Maker. I researched a ton of different waffle makers and always found a con. Also I didn’t feel the need to spend a lot of money on a waffle maker. This waffle maker was cheaper than in my local stores( even when it was on sale ). So when I saw this deal, which was lower than others, i had to buy it. It is easy to use, a good size, and eSy to clean up if you spray it down the first time with oil. My waffles come out looking great! Now I can make great aaffle at home instead of going out!
customer_reviews.author: SuspiroDeuce

customer_reviews.title: Soggy waffles
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is made of decent quality. I purchased this to make waffles for the kids. The waffles did not come out great... They were soggy every single time. My brother in law is a chef and it was the same result for him. We had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Luis P.

customer_reviews.title: Really good appliance for the price
customer_reviews.text: One of the many reasons that I love Amazon is because it's not just a shopping experience, it's educational. I was going to purchase a different waffle maker in the same price range, but it didn't have the temperature control that other customers thought was an important feature.I'm really happy with this purchase. It works great.I rated it 4 only because it's not something that will last a lifetime, although for the price I don't expect it to.
customer_reviews.author: Betty A. Chilly

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the waffle turn out but a small pain to wash
customer_reviews.text: I made waffles yesterday, as promised, for my 12-year old. He woke up extra early for them, which is saying something since he now sleeps till noon. I found a 5-star recipe online for the batter and then followed the device instructions on how to use. The waffles turned out perfectly! The only complaint is that this is a bit of a pain to wash. You can’t take the plates out and you can’t submerge in soapy water so you have to use a washcloth to go in and out of the grooves to clean. Besides this tedium, I love this and look forward to trying more recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L Repp

customer_reviews.title: Very good, look at my video
customer_reviews.text: No the block spots are not burnt that’s chocolate chips in there, very easy to clean and I pushed it down harder. The tip wasn’t like this it was Partially, but it was very good
customer_reviews.author: sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Cooking
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I have no idea how this waffle maker got positive reviews. The plates do not cook evenly, I assume because the heat is not distributed evenly. Top part cooks to a crisp before the bottom half of the waffle cooks at all. Awful
customer_reviews.author: R. D. HERMAN

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale as sort of an impulse buy, and used it today for the first time. The instructions are simple and it heated up quickly. I primed it with a little oil for the first one, and there was no sticking! Each waffle was easy to get out, and that made clean up super easy. I did have some batter come out over the sides, so was glad I had the waffle maker set up on a paper towel. 3/4th of a cup of batter, which is recommended, was a tad bit too much. Over all, this is a nice little Belgian waffle maker!
customer_reviews.author: P. White

customer_reviews.title: It's an Oster - Easy & Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This is not the most expensive waffler, but thought I'd try the reliable name. It will give you a waffle, but I still have to flip it for even browning. Cheap for a waffler. Do sacrifice the first few to the birds or compost because the metallic/oil smell/ taste is awful. Goes away after a few waffles. Not bad for an appliance I only use during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: gr8tchr4u

customer_reviews.title: A good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: A good value for the price. I've really enjoyed the waffles I've been making. I do wish it was a tad bit easier to clean, but the finish is such that I have and no problems with big pieces sticking to the iron surface. For use in my home, this is a great product to make waffles a few times a month.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: An excellent waffle maker at any price!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I used the waffle maker for the first time, and made sure to lightly oil the maker the first time. I was pleased with my first efforts... needed to add more waffle mix, and add just a little more water, and set the temperature just a bit higher than half way! Waffles did not stick, and they were light and fluffy! We are very pleased with this waffle maker!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Boucher

customer_reviews.title: It's a waffle maker!
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is fantastic. Does it's job well. Easy to clean and use. Simple and space-saving size. If you like a slightly dark/crispy waffle just set it right to medium or slightly above and give it at least 4 and a half minutes to do the job and it will get things done nicely.
customer_reviews.author: DK MannTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: But we ain't seen nothin yet !!
customer_reviews.text: This miserable appliance is not what i have had before in a Belgian type waffle iron. When you ad the batter to this thing, the top does not come down and press the batter into a deep Belgian type, crispy wafle. I have used three different mixes ...leting them thicken some...but it runs out of the machine before it cooks.....also, the explanations of the red and green lights must have been translated by a very drunk person...just hilarious. Its terrible to be so old and still have a very vivid memory as to how things used to be. Damn !
customer_reviews.author: Crush

customer_reviews.title: Unplug after every use
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke in my resent move. I liked well enough that I bought another one as a replacement. A good unit at a reasonable price. My only complaint is that the lights come on when the unit is off. I unplug mine after every use. Turning the unit off requires resetting the temp setting. Once you get this right it's best to leave alone. Still I like it.
customer_reviews.author: HuskyGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Make the best waffles. I’ve been using Aunt Jemima pancake and waffle mix. Waffles come out a pretty golden brown color. Very easy to use. I read other reviews and saw that some people were have trouble with waffles sticking or not coming out right....haven’t had that problem. I also do a tiny spray of canopy oil to the iron before I pour the batter in and I’ve had no issues
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in July and today in the middle of me makin waffles it just stopped working the orange power light went out and it stopped getting hot. Im so mad in the middle of makin breakfast and now I can't eat because its half cooked like what is this about oy should last longer than this. It worked good when it was working but didn't last even a year
customer_reviews.author: Chiquita Lee-rice

customer_reviews.title: Delivered without a package or box- disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed when I got home and noticed the waffle maker was sitting outside, and without a package. Anyone could have come up and taken it. I also bought this as a GIFT and would’ve REALLY appreciated it coming inside a package or box, instead of just slapping the shipping tag on and sending it out. Was also sitting outside our porch closer to the driveway... it could’ve been taken at any time. Next time it’d be great if you could put the merchandise inside a package. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Big, Delicious Waffles!
customer_reviews.text: I received this, and made waffles in it the next morning... and woah. Thicker than my thumb and bigger than my hand! The pockets were nice a deep, and held so much syrup too! The temperature control is wonderful to help select how soft or crisp the waffles are too. I can only eat one waffle before I get full - and I can usually eat quite a bit. It's great for when it's just me, and great for when my boyfriend is over when I make Breakfast for dinner. I just have to make sure to spray it every few waffles or else they stick - to be expected with most waffle irons though.
customer_reviews.author: DelmarvaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works great!
customer_reviews.text: This waffle iron is easy to use and clean. It works really well. The waffles come out fluffy, but still cooked all the way through. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Clark

customer_reviews.title: Try Alton Brown's waffle batter recipe (he also has a chocolate waffle recipe that is pretty good). It worked perfectly on this
customer_reviews.text: Powerful for an inexpensive little waffle maker. There are some reviews complaining about how it doesn't tell you when the waffle is ready, but if you read the manual, it tells you exactly how long it takes on each setting. If you don't have a kitchen timer, you've gotta have a phone right? Set the timer and stop complaining! Try Alton Brown's waffle batter recipe (he also has a chocolate waffle recipe that is pretty good). It worked perfectly on this machine
customer_reviews.author: yekaterina balagian

customer_reviews.title: Good value and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Picked this one because when we dragged the old one out it was just to hard to clean after years of use. The price was right and with its simple control all three kids can use it easily and clean it with minimal effort. A word of caution - the instructions say to use 3/4 cup of mix per waffle and from experience anything more than that and it will be oozing out.
customer_reviews.author: T. D. Bridges

customer_reviews.title: not a good product
customer_reviews.text: about a month after using this waffle iron 3 times a week it got to where you had to pry door open, than work at getting waffle out it got worst in 2 weeks and one day stuck real bad,had to throw away waffle iron now. i believe heatin g element burnt out. i usually get 2-3 years out of used waffle irons, 5 years on new ones. c. davis
customer_reviews.author: C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't make crisp waffles...
customer_reviews.text: Not terribly happy with this item - it makes waffles soggy, rather than crisp; it tends to get TOO dark in the pockets, and not dark enough otherwise; and the plates are not removable (as in my old waffle iron I replaced with this one) , so they are hard to clean. I would have returned it, but it was so inexpensive, and shipping it back would be more trouble and cost than it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Gordy

customer_reviews.title: Great Waffle Maker!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this waffle maker! Super simple and easy to use. I like the multiple choice settings to choose from for the way you want the waffle cooked. Takes no time to heat up, and depending on which setting you chose, makes the waffle very quickly. There are indicator lights which let you know when it is ready to use. Does not indicate when the waffle is done, but that is easy to tell without a light. Clean up is rather easy once done using. Takes up very little counter space, and is small if you prefer to store it in a cabinet instead.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great Waffle Iron and Reasonably Priced
customer_reviews.text: This waffle iron is great for the reasonable price and works very well. I made the Crispy Malted Waffles that are quite tedious to make but well worth the extra effort. I was a little concerned that the inexpensive waffle iron might not do the job. Happy to say I was wrong. The special waffles turned out crispy, light and very, very good. This waffle maker was light on my budget but did not compromise in quality and the clean up is a breeze too.
customer_reviews.author: S.Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing
customer_reviews.text: After reading all of the positive reviews I decided to but this waffle maker for myself. I got it first thing in the morning on the day it was said to be delivered. I cleaned it immediately following the directions and lightly oiled it as stated. By my first try I had perfect waffles. I put it on med heat and only poured 3/4cups like recommended. I had no over flow or anything and waffles came out golden brown. Only complaint I have is that the top doesnt seem sturdy to me, it shifts side to side a little which I dont think should happen. I would definitely reccomend this product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Temperature is tricky and it is difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: We are still trying to decipher the correct setting for not burning the waffles and it is not as easy to clean as I would want, especially if batter came down the sides. Also, I though the plates were removable, but that is on me for not reading the description correctly and not verifying it when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: Good maker and Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical I'm about getting this because I like using the one that rotate. But for the home this is truly not a bad little machine. Some reviews that you are read on here make it sound like it's difficult and you have to practice but like most machines ( like a toaster) you always have to adjusted to your liking. It's very easy to use and on my second try the waffles came out perfect and now I don't have to adjust anything. You'll enjoy this little machine and for the price it's a really good machine. Very easy to clean very easy to store away, good machine all the way
customer_reviews.author: Al A. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: waffles
customer_reviews.text: I love waffles. Any kind of way you can serve them. But this waffle iron will not get the steam up to make them crispy. I have owned a few waffle irons. These will not really get picture perfect. I have been able to get them just the way I want them from other waffle irons, but not this one. The ease of use is spot on. But nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: judygraham

customer_reviews.title: Yummy cooking
customer_reviews.text: My family loves our waffle maker, we think it is great! It gets out breakfast done. This is my first waffle maker, so I am not sure if other waffle makers leak around the edge, but sometimes it leaks and is a little messy, but overall I am happy and would buy it again. Great price and product.
customer_reviews.author: Feefee

customer_reviews.title: The kids and I LOVED this waffle maker
customer_reviews.text: The kids and I LOVED this waffle maker. The waffles comes out evenly browned and fluffy. There is a setting for how light or brown/crisp you want to make your waffle. It was easy to store as it stands vertically. However, I purchased this in January 2018 for my birthday and it stopped working a few days ago in April 2018. I'll probably get another that's how much I loved this waffle maker.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t even use it but it seemed way too hard to clean since the waffle grates can’t be removed. I imagine I would be very annoyed having to soap this thing and wipe it down completely with a rag every single time. I’d rather have some thing that’s removable that I can wash and rinse off with water
customer_reviews.author: Sarhad Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Make a waffle life short eat a waffle
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker was a Wonder everything about it was great except trying to clean it very difficult you have to use cleaner and a paper towel and keep cleaning and cleaning but making waffles is so simple and fast it is absolutely fantastic. I make keto chaffles. that's why I bought it. Make a waffle.
customer_reviews.author: Jcv

customer_reviews.title: This waffle maker is a gem!
customer_reviews.text: I missed having waffles and I didn't want to spend a bunch of money. I don't write reviews but I felt this little gem is great enough to pass on my opinion! It makes great waffles! I tried all the settings and thickness of batter and you will too - I like the medium setting for 4 minutes. Not messy and easy clean-up. Great gift for any occasion. Crispy when cold.
customer_reviews.author: Susan N.

customer_reviews.title: Good price, well made
customer_reviews.text: Good price, well made. Ordered one for very low price (from China I later found out) and gave up on it arriving after two month! Paid about $10 more for one sold here in America and it took about a week to get here.
customer_reviews.author: Martin White

customer_reviews.title: Cleanup is the only downside
customer_reviews.text: I want to start by saying that the waffle maker itself does a great job of producing a mouth watering waffle that I can't wait to eat. The only downside is cleanup with this product. No matter how careful I am, I always seem to have a little bit of overflow when cooking. That overflow gets into some tight spaces that can be a pain to clean. Other than that, excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Well Endowed

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this waffle maker for the past few months. It is a really useful appliance to have in the house. I purchased this one because it was cheap but still looked decent. It makes perfect waffles, it is a good size so it doesn't take up too much storage room but still produces nicely sized waffles. The only thing I would prefer is if I could detach the little griddle to wash it thoroughly. The instructions say to just wipe clean, but I also have to spray cooking spray/oil so the waffle doesn't stick, that becomes greasy and messy, but I cannot thoroughly clean it as I cannot put the whole waffle maker under the sink water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and works great
customer_reviews.text: This waffle maker is very easy to use. My 9 year old is even able to make her own waffles on it. It is still working great over a month later, and still makes perfect waffles. My kids had never had waffles before, and now they ask for them several times a week! Also worked well with making a waffle using an egg and a banana batter. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Martin

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC BUY
customer_reviews.text: I decided to leave reviews for the BEST life-changing products I bought for myself quarantine. This product is one of them! I research for the BEST QUALITY and VALUE in all my categories. Get it, I do not BS nor waste time and I coach people for a living. Your welcome!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel M.

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright
customer_reviews.text: It’s good for the price, but I’d suggest looking at other waffle makers. Ultimately, it’s up to you & your palate, but I don’t like the way they come out. I’ve tried different recipes, temperatures, etc. I wasn’t really satisfied with it, but the price wasn’t bad at all...choice is yours!
customer_reviews.author: V. Nobu

customer_reviews.title: I paid almost $70 for my waffle maker and this one was just 12 bucks it does everything mine does except it didn't cost a whole
customer_reviews.text: Out standing I paid almost $70 for my waffle maker and this one was just 12 bucks it does everything mine does except it didn't cost a whole lot I would buy it again I bought it for a gift for my brothers birthday he loves it
customer_reviews.author: Bonnieville SSEI

customer_reviews.title: Good waffle iron, very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little appliance that makes a standard Belgian style waffle. Small cord wraps around base for easy storage. The only thing I would like to see is a more accurate light indicator; its green "ready" light flicks off when batter is added, but comes on too soon for it to have fully cooked. Easy to wipe clean, great non-stick surface that doesn't require oil for each use.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Reader

customer_reviews.title: AKA: Our “Chaffle” Maker 🧇 !
customer_reviews.text: Oster’s Belgian Waffle Maker was well worth the 2 week wait. We have been extremely impressed with how easy it is to clean and “season” the plates for each use. The plates heat evenly and we have had amazing success making our “chaffles” - cheese 🧀 & egg 🥚 waffles 🧇.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Best Waffle maker especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this waffle maker because my son took my original and wanted an inexpensive replacement. I'm so impressed by it! It is so easy to use, easy to clean, has varying temperature control, and the price was exceptional. I used it to make waffles for a brunch at work and my co-worker brought her waffle maker and we ended up only using mine. I would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Barkman

customer_reviews.title: Works much better than anticipated.
customer_reviews.text: Not the waffle iron I really wanted, but I am impressed. Makes good Belgian waffles -- the thick, hearty ones with deep wells for butter and syrup. The only issue I've found is getting that slight crisp on the outside without burning the waffle.
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good price on a good product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Mom as a gift. She said that it works great! And Moms know best!
customer_reviews.author: Texas KnowHow

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this it's junk that Amazon sells
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like when you order something from Amazon that has to do with plugging into your wall outlet there's always something wrong with it I recommend buying your electrical devices from someone else
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works good!
customer_reviews.text: Makes a decent waffle but the temperature range is a little wide for my taste. Gets really got and then when the thermostat shuts off it cools too much. Non stick wise it is really good but I wish they had made it with tighter temperature range.
customer_reviews.author: Zrob213

customer_reviews.title: Pefect Belgian Small Waffle Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent small Belgian waffle maker. The controls are straight forward and the temperature range can be adjusted so the waffle comes out to your preferred level of "doneness" each time. It's easy to clean and small to store. We haven't had it long so I don't know how long it will last, but so far it's good.
customer_reviews.author: G C MERHOFF

customer_reviews.title: As advertised! Better than our old $400 one- no lie!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Works better than our old $400 one!! I absolutely love this! Works and looks as advertised. It’s very handy and wonderful. Waffles come out looking perfect- they think I’m a culinary talent now, hahaha
customer_reviews.author: Katie Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Makes the best Belgian waffles. You can control the temperature and make soft or firm waffles. It is easy to add ingredients. I’ve never had a issue with burnt waffles. It is very easy to clean and non stick. This is a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Fezell

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not great
customer_reviews.text: I like the small size of the waffle maker for storage and the non-stick works well. It takes some getting used to the maker and it’s usually the third or forth waffle that is finally crispy and cooked perfectly. The first couple waffles always seem to be mushy so I don’t think the griddles heat up and are ready when it says they are.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyintheD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for chaffles!!!! Ketogenic lifestyle 👌
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for homemade chaffles for the Keto lifestyle! Makes great Keto options for bun substitute for burgers. Even use for sandwiches or in place of waffles. It’s small enough to store easy and cleans up quick with a wet sponge. I also spray it down with white vinegar then paper towel it dry after using.
customer_reviews.author: BinaryCode

customer_reviews.title: You Just Might Buy More Than One!
customer_reviews.text: I really was expecting a $14.00 waffle maker... I received a very well made Oyster Belgian Waffle Maker! I can not be more pleased with the quality....It makes really nicely crunchy outside/ fluffy inside waffles....I had a 15 year old GE that I called Old Glory...she served me so well for many years, but just made regular sized square waffles, this one makes those 1 inch round big boys my family loves.....I'm seriously thinking of buying more for Christmas presents....just noticed that price went up to $18.00...even that is a bargain for a Christmas present! Happy waffe-ing, ing! :)
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for. It's okay for basic machine.
customer_reviews.text: Feels flimsy when handling product. It does the job and you get what you paid for I suppose. I ended up ordering a flip maker that was more sturdy, little bigger, and has a timer. Again, this will do the job but is the very basic and not what I was expecting completely. Arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Watch closely
customer_reviews.text: This makes great waffles but you have to watch it to make sure they don get too done. Unlike a waffle maker where you flip it over. There is a light that tells you when it should be done but it is not the best indication. Very easy to clean and fits in the cabinet well.
customer_reviews.author: Alma

product_meta.title: Oster Belgian Waffle Maker, Stainless Steel (CKSTWF2000)
product_meta.description: Enjoy fresh, homemade Belgian-style waffles with the Oster Belgian Waffle Maker. Featuring an 8-inch nonstick plate, this waffle maker creates large waffles with deep pockets that you can fill with tasty toppings and syrup. The temperature dial allows you to adjust the heat with a simple twist, so you can make your waffles as fluffy or crispy as you please, while the cool-touch handle offers a firm grip and helps prevent burns. This durable Belgian waffle iron is built with a sturdy stainless steel housing for long-lasting performance. And thanks to its indicator lights, the waffle maker clearly displays when the power is on and whether it is ready to bake.
feature_bullets: Belgian waffle maker creates large, round waffles with deep pockets that hold plenty of toppings and syrup
Waffle maker features an 8 inch nonstick plate that releases waffles easily and cleans quickly
Adjustable temperature control lets you customize heat while cooking, for different types of finishes and batters
Stainless steel housing offers added durability; Cord length: 27.5 inches, watts: 1080w
Safe to touch handle provides a firm grip and helps prevent burns

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars8,997 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
